stories.text:
I'm planning to start a discord community for accountability where people can post what their weekly/monthly goals are and the community keeps them accountable with daily check-ins.

I'm trying to gauge interest for this.
stories.title: Ask HN: Would you want to be a part of an accountability community?
IEEE Spectrum Top Programming Languages 2021: Python dominates once again
Technology increasingly used to 'victimise and control' women with disabilities

stories.text:
Hi HN.

I have a SaaS that has quite a few small and big customers. I am now in the process of negotiating terms with another potential big customer. And they want an SLA for support. Their suggestion on emergency incidents is 30 minutes response 24/7.

The nature of the service tells me it's not going to be any emergency incidents, but I don't like to put it there in writing. I am one person, and I love to sleep.

It's also not suggested this would cost them extra, but I will for sure charge for the SLA separately.

So 2 questions: - What would you state as emergency response time? - What would you charge?

Thanks for any and all answers!
stories.title: Ask HN: What to charge for support SLA for one-person SaaS
Why do computers stop and what can be done about it? [pdf]
